column3: when talking about someting near xx, it's better to use chikaku
negative: yokunai, past: yokatta. Best: ichiban i
ōkī akai ringo -> Big red apple
Biggest: ichiban ōkī ("dai" in hon reading)

dangerous: cool (cold) / breezey (eg air contitioning, used often as a relief)

column3: Used in old literature, still used in service industry
ex. henna tenki -> strange weather, henna hito -> strange person
an exception for ending in 'i' but it's a na adjective nonetheless
watashi no suki na tabemono wa ramen desu -> my favourite food is ramen
kirai-na tabemono -> the food I don't like
